Half life? More like No life. HA! BAZINGA. But for real though this is probably the best fps ever made. The game is good, the online multiplayer is good, and by purchasing it you get access to tons of terrible free mods and a handful of good ones adding hours to your experience. 10/10 baby.
A bona-fide classic. If you enjoy Portal or the Half-Life 2 games, this is a must play. And believe it or not, people still play the multiplayer.

This game... this game... I cannot put how awesome it is into real words. This game is just too good to actally be described with the english language. Seriously. This game is epic, exciting, breathtaking, awesome, occasionally funny, great and forever one of the greatest classics of ALL TIME. If you don't have it you shouldn't just be sitting there feeling sorry for yourself. GO GET YOUR CREDIT CARD!

Pretty fun game, even if it has outdated graphics. There are some challenging aspects in the game but nothing too difficult to do. A good game to play if you ever have that nostalgic moment or a desire to play old pc games.

My childhood's favorite game. Fantastic plot, graphics are a bit out-dated, but what did you expect for a 1999 game? Graphics don't matter here, story is amazing and well the A.I was great back then for the enemies. 

You won't find any other compelling game to match against HL1

Creo que está todo dicho sobre esta obra maestra. Si por casualidad nunca lo has jugado, dale una oportunidad, atrévete a adentrarte en Black Mesa y comprenderás porqué el diseño de todos los FPS actuales se basan en Half- Life. Para comprender el presente hay que conocer el pasado.

Hmm...the original. I completed this over a year ago but figure I should review it since I'm playing the expansions now. Despite its datedness, it is still an excellent action-adventure/survival-horror game, and you can tell why it spawned an entire series. 
Despite his suit, Gordon Freeman always feels like a normal human trapped in a bad situation made extraoridnary only by his brains and his will to survive.

The level design, for the time anyway, was innovative and you can still tell the amount of creative effort put into everything by the developers. It sort of reminded me of the original Deus Ex, minus the RPG elements (don't know which game came first off the top of my head).

My biggest complaint is there really isn't much option for stealthy takedowns in this game (every fight with more than one oppoenent, especially the soldiers, always degenerates to an all-out firefight). Not my favorite game ever by far, but still a solid 9/10.
An absolute classic and masterpiece of game design. If you haven't played this already then you should.
Old skool game, but still 1 of the best games of this time.

There's a reason this game is in the "Best Games of All Time" listings.  These days the gameplay and story are so incredible they completely forgive the slightly-wonky friendly NPC animation and AI.  a HUGE game world, Challangeing gameplay, This is the game I replay over and over again despite knowing every secret and every strategy.  It's just that good.   But avoid the "Source" version of the game, a remake useing the "Source" engine.
Классика, всем советаю.=)

One of my first video games, from when I was a wee lad. It's aged well; for fans of science fiction, horror, retro gaming, and first person shooters. This is basically the game that invented the 'reload' button; definitely worth checking out.
Is it possible to have steam and not own this game? Dont answer that.

I think everyone should own this game simply for the total value you can grab from it. There are numerous amounts of fantastic mods for this game, and some of the fps-horror ones such as Afraid of Monsters and Cry of Fear are better made than most commercial fps-horror games.

There's also Sven-Coop, which lets you play with friends on fantastic community made puzzle maps, action maps, and also the Half-Life campaign.

Barring all that, Half-Life is still a very solid fps on its own. For $10, you can have more content than you could ever play.
СТАВИТЬ!

Half-Life до сих пор прекрасно играется. Очень интересные уровни, чуток запутанные, но все равно крутые. Игра не позволяет расслаблятся мозгам. Гордон Фримэн - легенда, персонаж с большой буквы, единственный образ, который прекрасен даже при том, что он немой. Вселенная Half-Life уже тогда была живая: каждый делает свой дело, что-то происходит без вас, что-то с вами. Короче, после деградирующего игроков Call of Duty, размять мозги самое то. Ну что ж, а теперь аддоны))  It's time to choose...
It's a Half-Life, that's all you need to know. So go and buy it, NOW!

ALRIGHT! Listen. I know the graphics are "bad" and the sound "sucks" but hear me out, THIS GAME IS AMAZING! Stop wining about the bad graphics, IT WAS MADE IN 1998! WHAT WOULD YOU EXPECT!?!?! It was Valve's FIRST game. THIER FIRST! It's amazing! Get it with the Valve complete or HL1 Anthology. Don't like the graphics? YOU CAN GET PASSED IT! IT WAS MADE BEFORE WINDOWS XP FOR "CRYING OUT LOUD"! Bottom line is it's amazing and it is one of the many games you MUST own to consider yourself an awesome gamer. Nuff said.

Greatest PC game ever made IMO; organized and intricate level design, solid game engine, a wide variety of unforgettable enemies, smooth AI coding, refreshing arsenal that features conventional and unconventional weapons, and exciting and engaging music. Manages to tell a decent story without the use of cutscenes. Extremely few bugs.
Play this game. I mean what the fuck else are you doing with your life?

[h1]Review:[/h1]
You play as the theoretical physicist Dr. Gordon Freeman. It's another casual day at Black Mesa (a secret underground research facility) when a catastrophic event called "the resonance cascade" happens after you conduct your special experiment.
[b]Half-Life has been named "Best Game of All Time" three times in 1999, 2001 and 2005 by the magazine PC Gamer.[/b]
If you haven't played the game yet I strongly recommend to check it out.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Superb story
[*]A lot of enemies to kill
[*]Many levels to complete
[*]A lot of weapon choice
[*]Superb voice acting
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]None, nada
[/list]

[h1]Score: [b]10/10[/b][/h1]

[h1]P.S.[/h1] 
I also recommend checking out the Source Engine mod [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/]Black Mesa[/url] as an alternative to Half-Life.
The problem with that mod is that the single player campaign is not entirely finished yet (the last level of the game is missing).
[b]Also if you don't want to pay for the mod you can download it for [u]FREE[/u] from its [url=http://www.blackmesasource.com/]official website here.[/url][/b]

[b]Thank you for taking the time to read my review.[/b]

[b]If you enjoyed this review feel free to follow my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/heat_official#curation][h1]Steam Curator page[/h1][/url][/b]

So hit me up if you ever get into them.

This goes to show that even though it is dated nowadays the quake engine II still holds its own.

As you can tell from my avatar, I LOVE the Half-Life series! Although not the slickest looking game (released in 2005) the original HL is still challenging and lots of fun. I played through HL2, HL: Episode One and most of HL: Episode Two before starting this game and I see why the series is the benchmark for Sci-fi FPS games. XLNT!!

*Review Re-Approached 11/19*
I played this again recently and while it's still an excellent game it's age is really starting to show.
The movement is really icy, it's difficult to stop, easy to over or undershoot where you want to be, ladders are of course - abhorrent as per valve requirements and gun-play leaves a lot to be desired.
Towards the end I just stuck on noclip and godmode so I could finish and move on to half-life 2.

My biggest gripes however was:
*There are no subtitles.
*The crosshair is almost impossible to see at larger resolutions. (Of course this was made for much smaller resolutions back in the day)
*Whoever designed the controls for the long jump backpack needs to be fired.
(You have to hold crouch, walk forward a step or two and jump normally to leap forward, it's archaic)

Having said that the atmosphere, music story and tone of this game still stands up today and the effect half-life has had on PC gaming cannot be understated.

Works well under linux. Can't say I had problems. One or two bugs regarding the AI and keyboard input getting locked on an area load but totally manageable.

Что ж, я таки прошел эту игру. Даже спустя 14 (!) лет после выхода, она способна удивить. Представляю какой резонанс был в 1998 году. Игра не зря заслужила свою славу. Да и реиграбельность, думаю у нее поболе, чем у современных экшен-игр. Игра заставляет пошевелить мозгами, а не просто пострелять в монстров и спецназовцев. Думаю за эти годы уже сказано о всех плюсах этой игры. Добавлю только, что мне, как казуальщику и нелюбителю долгих и нудных прохождений, игра понравилась.
